cardiology.name: Cardiology

overview.description: Cardiology is a medical specialty that focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of conditions affecting the heart and cardiovascular system. Our medical tourism platform connects patients with the best cardiology hospitals and doctors worldwide, offering advanced diagnostic tools, cutting-edge treatment options, and cost-effective healthcare solutions.

treatments.name: Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG)
treatments.description: Bypasses blocked coronary arteries using grafts to restore blood flow to heart muscle.
treatments.recovery: ICU 1–2 days; hospital 5–7 days; return to normal activities in ~6–12 weeks with cardiac rehab.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: What helps to find the best hospital?
treatments.topDoctors: How to select the best doctor?
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: How to select the best doctor?
diagnosticTools: coronary CT angiography in selected cases
advantages: Proven symptom relief and survival benefit in left‑main/multivessel disease
durable revascularization vs PCI in complex CAD
treatments.detailedCost: India private hospitals: ~₹2–7 lakh depending on city, grafts, and risk profile; extra for ICU days/complications.

faq.question: How long do grafts last?
faq.answer: Arterial grafts often >10–15 yrs; vein grafts shorter.

treatments.name: Angioplasty & Stenting (PCI)
treatments.description: Catheter‑based reopening of blocked coronary arteries with balloons and stents.
treatments.recovery: Home same/next day in many cases; full recovery in ~1 week for uncomplicated cases.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: What helps to find the best hospital?
treatments.topDoctors: How to select the best doctor?
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: How to select the best doctor?
doctorSelectionList: Ask operator/hospital PCI volumes and outcomes
advancedTreatmentOptions: mechanical circulatory support in high‑risk PCI
advantages: Rapid symptom relief and improved outcomes in ACS
short recovery
treatments.detailedCost: India private‑hospital ballpark for straightforward PCI often ₹1.2–3.5 lakh. Stent type/number and imaging add cost.

faq.question: When is CABG preferred?
faq.answer: Left‑main/multivessel diabetes or complex scores—team decision.

faq.question: When can I drive?
faq.answer: Usually in a week if uncomplicated.

treatments.name: Valve Repair & Replacement (SAVR/TAVR)
treatments.description: Surgical (SAVR/repair) or catheter‑based (TAVR) correction of diseased heart valves.
treatments.recovery: SAVR stay ~5–8 days; full recovery 4–8 weeks. TAVR often 1–3 day stay; faster recovery (days).
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: What helps to find the best hospital?
treatments.topDoctors: How to select the best doctor?
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: How to select the best doctor?
doctorSelectionList: Ask SAVR/TAVR volumes and stroke/mortality rates
shared decision‑making on valve type (mechanical vs tissue)
advantages: Symptom relief and survival benefit in severe valve disease
quicker recovery with TAVR
treatments.detailedCost: In India, TAVR devices + hospitalization commonly ~$30,000–$42,000 in private centers; SAVR markedly less. Anticoagulation considerations for mechanical valves.

treatments.name: Pacemaker & ICD Implantation
treatments.description: Device implantation to treat bradyarrhythmias (pacemaker) or prevent malignant ventricular arrhythmias (ICD).
treatments.recovery: Overnight stay common; arm movement restricted for 1–2 weeks; return to normal activity in ~1–2 weeks.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: What helps to find the best hospital?

treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: How to select the best doctor?
advantages: Symptom relief and mortality reduction in indicated patients
treatments.costConsiderations: Cost varies with device type and brand
treatments.detailedCost: Cost varies with device type (single/dual, CRT, ICD) and brand. Insurance pre‑authorization and device warranty are key.

faq.question: MRI‑compatible?
faq.answer: Many new systems are; confirm model.

treatments.duration: 1–3 hours depending on arrhythmia type; GA or conscious sedation.
treatments.recovery: Most return to work in ~1 week; avoid heavy lifting 1 week.

treatments.detailedCost: Drivers: mapping system, energy source, LOS. Many centers perform as overnight or day‑care in uncomplicated cases.

treatments: IV Thrombolysis/Mechanical Thrombectomy for Acute Ischemic Stroke

treatments.name: IV Thrombolysis/Mechanical Thrombectomy for Acute Ischemic Stroke
treatments.description: Emergency reperfusion treatments for blocked brain arteries to reduce disability.
treatments.duration: IV thrombolysis decision within minutes; thrombectomy procedure typically ~1–2 hours.
treatments.recovery: Hospital stay varies; early rehab starts in 24–48 h; recovery spans weeks to months depending on severity.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: What helps to find the best hospital?
treatments.topDoctors: How to select the best doctor?
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: How to select the best doctor?
doctorSelectionList: Endovascular neurologist/neurosurgeon with regular thrombectomy volumes
advancedTreatmentOptions: mechanical thrombectomy up to 16–24 h in selected cases
advantages: Large disability reduction when delivered rapidly
extended‑window thrombectomy benefits carefully selected patients
treatments.costConsiderations: Drug cost (TNK/TPA) often ₹0.45–1.2 lakh; mechanical thrombectomy commonly ~₹5–6 lakh mean in private centers; rehab adds extra.
treatments.detailedCost: Drug cost (TNK/TPA) often ₹0.45–1.2 lakh; mechanical thrombectomy commonly ~₹5–6 lakh mean in private centers; rehab adds extra.

faq.question: What is the time window?
faq.answer: IVT ≤4.5 h; EVT up to 16–24 h in selected patients.

Our medical tourism platform connects patients with the best oncology hospitals and doctors worldwide, offering advanced diagnostic tools, cutting-edge treatment options, and cost-effective healthcare solutions.

treatments.name: Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors (PD-1/PD-L1, CTLA-4)
treatments.description: IV monoclonal antibodies that block PD‑1/PD‑L1 or CTLA‑4 to help T‑cells attack cancer.
treatments.duration: Infusion ~30–60 min; given every 3 or 6 weeks depending on drug/regimen; total course often 6–24 months or until progression.
treatments.recovery: Outpatient. Monitoring needed for immune‑related adverse events which can occur during treatment or weeks after.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: What helps to find the best hospital?

topDoctors.title: Top-rated oncologists worldwide
topDoctors.description: How to select the best doctor?
selectionCriteria: seek second opinion when major decisions are needed

advantages: Potential for durable responses
survival benefit in several cancers
treatments.detailedCost: Drug cost is the main driver. India reference prices: pembrolizumab 100 mg ~₹1.6–1.9 Lakh/vial; 200 mg ~₹2.8–3.6 Lakh (before hospital fees). Dosing 200 mg q3w or 400 mg q6w. Pre‑auth and biomarker testing needed.

faq.question: Which cancers?
faq.answer: Many—including lung, melanoma, kidney, H&N—subject to biomarkers.

faq.question: How long?
faq.answer: Until response plateau or 2 years typical.

treatments.name: Mastectomy
treatments.description: Surgical removal of a breast; may include sentinel lymph node biopsy and/or reconstruction.
treatments.duration: 2–3 hours for simple/skin‑sparing; longer with reconstruction.
treatments.recovery: Hospital stay ~1–3 days; return to routine in ~4–6 weeks; limited arm activity initially.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: Accreditation; high breast‑surgery volume; availability of oncoplastic reconstruction; pathology turnaround; tumor board.
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: Experience with sentinel‑node and oncoplastic techniques; infection and re‑op rates; patient‑reported outcomes.
doctorSelectionList: Experience with sentinel‑node and oncoplastic techniques
advantages: Oncologic control
can reduce re‑excision risk vs lumpectomy in select scenarios

treatments.name: Radical Prostatectomy
treatments.description: Removal of prostate and seminal vesicles; can be open, laparoscopic, or robotic.
treatments.recovery: Hospital stay 1–2 days; urinary catheter ~1–2 weeks; back to desk work ~2–4 weeks.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: High surgeon and hospital volumes; continence/erectile function programs; multidisciplinary care.
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: Ask surgeon's annual volumes and positive margin, continence/erection outcomes; get a second opinion.
advantages: Definitive local control in localized disease
accurate pathologic staging
treatments.detailedCost: Driver = approach (robotic vs open), LOS, consumables. Insurance coverage varies.

treatments.name: Colectomy (Colon Resection)
treatments.description: Surgical removal of part/all of the colon with re‑anastomosis or stoma.
treatments.recovery: Hospital stay ~3–7 days; full recovery ~6 weeks; ERAS pathways speed recovery.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: High colorectal‑surgery volumes; stoma nurse; ICU; ERAS program.
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: Ask for leak rates, conversion rates (lap to open), LOS, and 30‑day readmissions.

advantages: Curative in localized disease
symptom relief in obstruction/bleeding
treatments.detailedCost: Costs vary by extent and approach; private‑hospital estimates in India often ~$840–2,160 for straightforward cases; complex cases higher.

treatments.name: Debulking (Cytoreductive) Surgery
treatments.description: Extensive surgery to remove as much tumor as possible (commonly in advanced ovarian cancer).
treatments.duration: Can take 4–8+ hours depending on disease spread.
treatments.recovery: ICU step‑down common; hospital stay ~7–10 days; full recovery 6–8 weeks.
treatments.hospitalSelectionCriteria: Experienced gyn‑onc team; high‑volume cytoreduction program; MDT with medical oncology and radiology; nutrition and rehab support.
hospitalSelectionList: MDT with medical oncology and radiology
treatments.doctorSelectionCriteria: Ask optimal‑debulking rates, transfusion and complication rates, LOS; ensure center offers MDT review.
advancedTreatmentOptions: HIPEC in select cases at specialized centers
advantages: Greater residual‑tumor clearance correlates with better survival in ovarian cancer
treatments.costConsiderations: High due to OR time, ICU, transfusions.
treatments.detailedCost: High due to OR time, ICU, transfusions; discuss risk of bowel/urinary resections and ostomy.

globalHospitals.about:
Fortis Memorial Research Institute (FMRI) is a premier quaternary care hospital located in Gurugram, Delhi NCR. Established in 2013, FMRI is part of the Fortis Healthcare network and is recognized as one of India's most advanced healthcare facilities.

As a quaternary care hospital, FMRI specializes in complex medical procedures and treatments that are not available at most other hospitals. The institute is equipped with cutting-edge medical technology including Gamma Knife for brain tumor surgery, Da Vinci Xi robotic surgery system, and MR LINAC for advanced cancer treatment.

FMRI operates with 330+ patient beds, 15 operating theaters, and 105 ICU beds, making it one of the largest healthcare facilities in the region. The hospital serves over 2 million patients annually and has a team of 200+ specialist doctors.

Key Highlights:
• First hospital in India to offer CAR T-Cell Therapy
• Advanced robotic surgery capabilities
• State-of-the-art cardiac care and transplant programs
• Comprehensive cancer treatment center
• 24/7 emergency services with specialized trauma care

FMRI is accredited by JCI, NABH, and NABL, ensuring the highest standards of patient care and safety. The hospital is strategically located 25 minutes from Indira Gandhi International Airport and is easily accessible via the HUDA City Center Metro Station.

globalHospitals.about:
Located in the heart of south Delhi, the 539+ bed Max Super Speciality Hospital, Saket, is widely considered as one of the best hospitals in the country. Split into two blocks - East Block (a unit of Devki Devi Foundation) and West Block ( a unit of MHIL - Max Healthcare Institute Limited), it has a complete spectrum of diagnostic and therapeutic technologies, including several which are a First in India and Asia.


Experts at Max Super Speciality Hospital, Saket, have treated more than 34 lakh patients across 32 specialities combined in the East and West wings. The East wing specializes in treating patients for Cardiac, Oncology (Medical, Surgical, and Radiotherapy), Transplant services (Heart, Lung, Bone Marrow), and General Surgery including Minimal Access and Bariatric Surgery, while the West wing focuses on Nephrology, Neurology, Neurosurgery, Rheumatology, Urology, Transplant Services (Liver & Renal), Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery, and other ancillary services. Max Super Speciality Hospital, Saket, offers a complete spectrum of diagnostic and therapeutic technologies, including several state-of-the-art technologies that are the first in Asia and India. The hospital has received NABH and JCI accreditation for providing the highest quality of patient safety and care.


Max Super Speciality Hospital, Saket, offers the advantage of integrated medical care in a multidisciplinary setting provided by a faculty of highly qualified doctors, nurses, & healthcare professionals. Max Super Speciality Hospital, Saket, is a regional hub for complex procedures such as neurovascular intervention, targeted cancer treatments, heart surgeries, orthopaedic surgeries, liver & kidney transplant, and fertility treatments.

It is part of the IHH Healthcare network and is known for pioneering procedures like India's first adult swap liver transplant, uterus transplant, and minimally invasive lung transplant. The hospital integrates cutting-edge technology with compassionate care, attracting patients from over 50 countries.

Vision:
To be the most trusted destination for advanced healthcare in Asia.

Mission:
To deliver world-class medical care through innovation, integrity, and patient-centric excellence.

globalDoctors.about: Dr. Jayant Arora is a leading Orthopaedic surgeon with over 24 years of experience, specializing in joint replacement, robotic knee surgery, and sports injury management. Trained in premier institutions across India and the UK, he has pioneered computer-navigated and robotic-assisted knee replacements in India. As Senior Director & Unit Head of Orthopaedics at Fortis Memorial Research Institute, Gurgaon, Dr. Arora is renowned for delivering world-class outcomes in complex surgeries with cutting-edge technology and minimally invasive techniques.

globalDoctors.researchWork: Dr. Jayant Arora has an extensive research background in the fields of knee arthroplasty, joint replacement, and orthopaedic trauma. His research work spans both clinical and surgical domains, focusing on: Computer-Navigated and Robotic-Assisted Knee Replacement: Dr. Arora has been a pioneer in integrating advanced technologies in knee surgeries, including patient-specific implants and computer navigation systems. Osteolysis in Modular Knee Implants: His work studied the prevalence and implications of osteolysis in primary modular Freeman Samuelson total knee replacements. Preoperative Templating in Total Knee Replacement: Investigated the effectiveness of preoperative planning and templating on outcomes in TKR patients. Arthroscopic Techniques in Sports Injuries: Conducted research and case studies on arthroscopic surgical approaches for managing soft tissue injuries and chronic conditions like shoulder instability. Innovations in External Fixation: Studied the role and efficacy of external fixators in intra-articular distal radius fractures, including prospective trials and long-term outcomes. Joint Preservation and Partial Knee Replacement: He contributed research on the Oxford Partial Knee Replacement and minimally invasive surgery for joint preservation. Rare Orthopaedic Cases: Authored case reports on rare orthopaedic conditions such as recurrent osteoid osteoma and transulnar dislocations. His research was recognized during his clinical fellowship in the UK and he has been actively involved in mentoring and training orthopaedic surgeons through his research findings and clinical experience.

globalDoctors.about: Dr. Subhash Jangid is a globally recognized orthopaedic surgeon and Senior Director at Fortis Memorial Research Institute, Gurgaon, with over 25 years of experience and more than 20,000 successful procedures. A pioneer in robotic and computer-navigated joint replacement, he has contributed to implant innovation and led India's first bone bank initiative. His expertise in complex knee, hip, and shoulder replacements, coupled with minimally invasive techniques, makes him a leading choice for international patients seeking advanced orthopaedic care in India.

globalDoctors.researchWork: Dr. Subhash Jangid has been actively involved in clinical and surgical research within the field of orthopaedics, particularly focusing on joint replacement surgery, arthroscopy, and bone preservation techniques. His research interests include: Joint Replacement Innovations: He contributed to the development of a customized knee implant designed specifically for the Asian population, optimizing fit and function for regional anatomical variations. Minimally Invasive Surgery: He has studied the impact of computer navigation and robotic-assisted joint replacements on patient outcomes, precision in implant placement, and faster recovery times. Bone Banking: He was part of the team that helped establish India's first bone bank based on international tissue preservation standards—critical for cases needing bone grafts during joint or trauma surgery. Implant Design & Instrumentation: He holds a USFDA-approved patent for a femoral component extraction instrument used in revision knee replacement surgeries. Postoperative Recovery Protocols: His work also explores protocols that reduce hospital stay and improve post-surgical mobility in elderly patients.

globalDoctors.about: Dr. Manoj Padman is a leading Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgeon with over 25 years of experience, including a decade of advanced training and practice in the UK. Currently Director of Paediatric Orthopaedics at Fortis Memorial Research Institute, Gurgaon, he specializes in complex hip reconstruction, deformity correction, limb lengthening, and neuromuscular disorders. With global fellowships, UK board certifications, and a research degree from the University of Leeds, he brings world-class expertise to children requiring highly specialized orthopaedic care in India.

globalDoctors.researchWork: Dr. Padman has a robust academic and research background. During his training in the UK, he conducted foundational research on biological reactions to conventional and modern polyethylene materials used in arthroplasty. This research earned him a Master's in Research from the University of Leeds. He has a clinical interest in post-infective and post-traumatic orthopaedic sequelae, hip pathology, and deformity correction, and he has contributed to developing surgical protocols for managing neuromuscular and congenital paediatric conditions.
publications: He completed a Master's in Research at the University of Leeds (UK) in 2004, during which he studied the biological reaction to conventional versus newer polyethylene implants used in joint replacements.

He presented clinical and case‑based lectures at regional, national, and international conferences—such as POSI (Paediatric Orthopaedic Society of India) events—focusing on pediatric trauma and elbow injuries, including sessions on lateral condyle and supracondylar fractures. He served as faculty for several of these workshops.
